rComments: He is a knowledgeable professor, but be careful to select his class if you are not well prepared.
I don't recommend this professor if you want to be successful or graduated. He is not organized and well-structured on the materials.

Professor McCurdy is a chill professor. We had two small quizzes and bigger written/video assignments (fairly straightforward). There is a Wikipedia portion of his class that included weekly exercises/training and a final group entry at the end. Though I enjoyed having Prof McCurdy here, his Wikipedia portion felt like a whole new class in itself.

Prof McCurdy is very knowledgeable and experienced in communications. His lectures are well organized and engaging. This course had some great projects with enough flexibility to allow creativity. There were great class discussions too. He's understanding and flexible. Highly recommend his courses.

Professor McCurdy's lectures were clear and easy to follow. However, I sometimes felt as though what we were tested on did not reflect what we learned the most about in class. If you put effort into the assignments, you will see great results. He is super accessible and really wants to see everyone in his class succeed. Great guy!

Mccurdy is pretty cool. Best covid response i've seen this sem. One thing though is that it is a class you need to engage with to understand and then maybe you'll also understand the "tangents" some are speaking of. He's pretty chill, like a student teacher almost. He super wants to be better and do better where he can. Surely won't chase you thoug

I also don't understand all the bad ratings. Patrick leads great class discussions and brings relevant topics into the class. He seemed like a good guy in the few interactions I had with him and brought in great guest lecturers. My only slight is the work load is extremely heavy, it's a lot of writing throughout the entire semester.

I only had professor McCurdy for a COVID shortened semester, but I really don't understand the bad ratings. He is a very intelligent professor who graded on papers and not tests. He made the social movements class into an environmental comms class as that is he research area. His syllabus is way too intimidating for the actual material.
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: He is a smart professor however extremely unclear with projects and overall is unorganized/unstructured in his teaching of concepts/materials.. for example he will introduce a topic and then go off on tangents not exactly stating relevant information in some kind of order.. he is scatter brained

Good researcher and very knowledgeable, but arrogant and doesn't seem to care about his students. Extremely harsh grader and lots of reading. Instructions for assignments are not clear. I don't recommend.
Professor McCurdy has actually been one of my fave profs at the university. He's really nice and willing to help ( office hours or after class). The assignments were really straightforward

Heavy reading & attendance is necessary. Goes off on tangents a lot but isn't clear. Tests are very hard & vague. The only decent grading is the project/paper. Do NOT ask for the course code at the final. He will be rude & embarrass you in front of everyone. Not for people who already have trouble focusing. Got better grades in harder classes.

Professor McCurdy has been one of my favourite CMN professors at uOttawa. He is extremely intelligent and lectures with a real passion for sharing his knowledge. He tends to speak quickly but if you pay attention and attend most lectures this was an easy A. Virtually anything missed in class is in the textbook. Super nice guy too, highly recommend!

It's a very tough class. An enormous amount of reading. Requires alot of studying to obtain a good grade. He goes off topic often during his lectures, and sometimes is unclear. Takes alot of work to get a good grade. Not an easy A.

I tell you guys, NEVER EVER TAKE HIS CLASS, we're going to have the final test tomorrow and he JUST posted the 2 missing PPTs, at midnight. I really don't know what's in his mind and this guy does not give a good description on the assignment!

lol dont take 3 hour classes with him, seriously really boring... like REALLY boring but the material itself isint really interesting to begin with, also he assigned 2 textbooks?? which was annoying because one textbook seemed useless. if you attend class and study youll be good

The most dry, boring, and useless lecture ever. He would go off of power point presentations that weren't all that useful or clear either, and rumble on and on. Very condescending and doesn't come across as approachable at all. Doesn't seem like a prof that cares whether you pass or fail. Doesn't reply to your emails. Assigning 2 books was a waste
too much to do.
teacherRatingTags: ['Get ready to read', 'Test heavy', 'So many papers']

rComments: Despite the other reviews, Professor McCurdy has been my favourite CMN prof thus far. He makes the effort to engage his students, use current materials, movies and articles, and very clearly conveys information. Midterm very straight forward. Major assignment very interesting. Very knowledgeable and engaging professor, not a difficult class!!
teacherRatingTags: ['Amazing lectures ', 'Clear grading criteria', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: Lectures are extremely ramble-y, hard to follow, and unclear. TONS of reading. Exam/midterm questions often heavily based on readings, and don't always feel very relevant to the material (a lot of trick questions, IMO). Prof comes across as condescending and has a superiority complex. I would not recommend taking this course from this prof!

LOTS of readings assigned out of 2 textbooks, I only read the one and still passed. Will reward you for going to class, he gave bonus points for students that attended a non-mandatory lecture (5%). He is very helpful if you go and see him at his office hours. Does not post lectures online.

Compared to the other posts I found McCurdy to be a fair marker. His Multiple Choice is tough but his short answer questions are very easy and clear and average out your grade.  He'll boost your mark if there's a trend of improvement in your grades over the term. Lectures are helpful too, and going to them meant I only had to skip the textbooks.

Had it as a 3 hour class, and he would take about 2 hours to do the first half of the lecture, and then the second half would barely be covered or touched on. He has been pretty condescending in class, so I was too scared to ask for help. The midterm was super specific and asked questions that didn't seem to be very crucial to the material.

Extremely difficult midterm. The mc section was way too confusing and questions were unnecessarily specific. Lots and lots of reading, and you need two textbooks which sucks. Anyway, wouldn't recommend. Could drop your average...

His exams feel more like he's testing what you DON'T know instead of what you DO. He's condescending when you ask for help. His ppt's are mostly pictures so you have to take really good notes. His midtermfinal focused on random details that no one knew were important. Would not take his class again.
Great professor, really passionate about what he teaches. Exams were really easy. 2 textbooks though so there was a lot of reading
Bad midterm. Entire questions on videos and other material that he barely touched on in class. mc section was confusing. Reads his lectures bad bad bad

Very specific and extremely difficult tests; his second year course is harder than the third year version. You'll have to memorize minuscule details and read, reread and rereread. Would not recommend - this class could tank your grade.

Honestly the hardest class I've taken/will ever take. His exams are impossibly hard, and I literally went to every lecture and read the entire textbook. He had to have bell curved the final because I don't know a single person who walked out with confidence.
Doesn't put slides online but they're not very helpful anyways. Doesn't use microphone so can be hard to hear at times. Very friendly and approachable.

I personally hate this class. His lectures are so boring and his ppt's suck. They consist of mainly pictures. He doesn't post his slides. It wouldn't matter anyway, they suck! He talks way too fast and stutters the whole time. He simply reads his notes he has in his hand the entire lecture. He assigned 2 textbooks for the course, which also sucks.

Great course! Attend lectures - he doesn't post his slides and he tells you the most important information. Shows video clips and documentaries. He makes it interesting. The readings are important - pay attention to details. Clear expectations and fair tests (if you study hard). Definitely recommend!!

Great Prof with engaging lectures. Made a Theory class actually somewhat bearable. Need to be in class to do well, as he narrows things down/spends a great deal of time on what you need to know. Midterm/exam were tough, but fair to those in class. Attend class, pay attention, study and you won't have a hard time getting a good grade with him.
